Articles.Content:
Who wants a quick 3 ship, max 250 tonne battle? Choose any body you like.

Also, I've gone to absurdities trying to protect my engines...

@Frozen_Heart:

Running some "simulations" with our ships while I wait for your move.

http://imgur.com/a/LGxpm

No target: Confirmed kill.

3 salvos of 2 Mark II I-Beam rockets. One salvo missed entirely. So 4 MkII's.

I didn't even fire the SRBs!

The lag was real, though.

Yeah, I was gonna say, those ships are really nice looking but they don't seem to be thick enough to hold up against a shot, especially in the center.

Yeah, I was gonna say, those ships are really nice looking but they don't seem to be thick enough to hold up against a shot, especially in the center.

In the center, where the core is, so it's super easy to target :/.

EDIT: Holy crap!

[LOG 09:53:00.825] landerCabinSmall (CJS Revenge) collided into structuralIBeam3 - relative velocity: 284.8127 - impact momentum: 53.4

[LOG 09:53:00.826] landerCabinSmall (CJS Revenge) Exploded!! - blast awesomeness: 0.5

[LOG 09:53:02.214] [landerCabinSmall (CJS Revenge)]: Deactivated

[LOG 09:53:02.214] [Orbit Targeter]: Target is null

[LOG 09:53:02.217] [03:23:22]: Jan Kerman was killed.

[LOG 09:53:02.218] [03:23:22]: Mk1 Lander Can collided into M-Beam 200 I-Beam Pocket Edition.

[LOG 09:53:02.219] landerCabinSmall collided into structuralIBeam3 - relative velocity: 284.8221 - impact momentum: 53.4

[LOG 09:53:02.220] [Explosion] Combined.

[LOG 09:53:02.221] landerCabinSmall Exploded!! - blast awesomeness: 0.5

[LOG 09:53:02.225] [adapterSmallMiniShort]: Deactivated

[LOG 09:53:02.231] [landerCabinSmall]: Deactivated

Not only is that confirmation of death, look at that velocity!!!

Dem's what you get for an 8-sepatron MkII I-Beam rocket

Edited October 28, 2014 by Starwhip

The armour is thick on some places but the core is totally exposed. Easy to target and a single shot will split the ship in half!

I've tested the armour and its effective as it is dual layered but this doesn't matter when you can just go round it.

Tempted to redesign but going for full armour coverage will increase part count and lower dV.

When proper mp comes out things will change as my ships high acceleration and dV will play havoc with your weapons!

tempted to redesign but going for full armour coverage will increase part count and lower dv.

WELCOME . TO. MY. WORLD. Caps

WELCOME . TO. MY. WORLD. Caps

I could make two versions of each of my ships? A display version and a battle version.

Display version focuses on looks while battle version on armour.

I could make two versions of each of my ships? A display version and a battle version.

Display version focuses on looks while battle version on armour.

Lol, I get to play the not so fun game of "what needs more armor?" With my drek... It's constant catch up and always raises part count and weight.

Lol, I get to play the not so fun game of "what needs more armor?" With my drek... It's constant catch up and always raises part count and weight.

Maybe prioritising less armour and more dV could work with the Drek. Move it into a polar orbit after shooting and then back again next turn! On lower gravity planets my ships can completely reverse their orbits multiple times!

Still taking your turn later today, Frozen_Heart?

Also, does your second lightest ship have* to engage my lightest ship, now that your lightest is dead?

*You could choose not to attack, I suppose.

EDIT: Be grateful that I don't have any of my ships armed with these...

New Mark II Driller missile. Salvo of four completely obliterates all ships I've tested them on.

Edited October 28, 2014 by Starwhip

Still taking your turn later today, Frozen_Heart?

Also, does your second lightest ship have* to engage my lightest ship, now that your lightest is dead?

*You could choose not to attack, I suppose.

Yeah I'm doing my turn soon

And yeah I assume my gunship goes next. Pretty sure you don't miss a turn if your lightest ship is destroyed...

Also I though you could shoot at any ship?

New Mark II Driller missile. Salvo of four completely obliterates all ships I've tested them on.

that part count...

2- Each player takes it in turns to engage one target with one ship.

3- Ships engage in order of tonnage, lightest to heaviest. Once all ships are used the cycle repeats.

I thought equal weight categories engaged one another...

If that's not the case then *facepalm*

I should've gone for another target. That capital ship scares the bejesus out of me. (Weapons-wise, not destructibility )

that part count...

Yesh. The part count alone shall summon the power of the Kraken on all ships!

(Not really, though.)

...

Ideas... :evilgrin:

Yesh. The part count alone shall summon the power of the Kraken on all ships!

every time I fire at my XIV-XII it won't let me go back to SPH or space center can I use this to my advantage?

It's a bug in the game

its so very annoying when I'm trying to test ships but thankfully it doesn't happen in combat because there is no quick saving

This thing... Holy cow. When you fire it it just goes:

"WIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLE" And it shoots off into the sunset. You see like 30 copies of the Sepatron exhaust scattered everwhere, and then it just goes *poof*. It moves so fast that I couldn't get a screenshot.

EDIT:

Screw a screenshot, have some spam.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited October 28, 2014 by Starwhip

its so very annoying when I'm trying to test ships but thankfully it doesn't happen in combat because there is no quick saving

That happens to me at times in combat forcing me to read download the game file.

And even if there was quick save it wouldn't work because the bug renders all operations like qs, revert, sc, and all that jazz inoperable.

Basically it forces you to force quit the game and reload from the games last autosave before the bug happened

http://i.imgur.com/RR52imK.png

This thing... Holy cow. When you fire it it just goes:

"WIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLEWIGGLE" And it shoots off into the sunset. You see like 30 copies of the Sepatron exhaust scattered everwhere, and then it just goes *poof*. It moves so fast that I couldn't get a screenshot.

thats the most kerbal thing I've ever heard

Starwhip: for this game keep going with these rules. I'll engage your lightest ship first.

In future I don't think it works that way though.

Starwhip: for this game keep going with these rules. I'll engage your lightest ship first.

In future I don't think it works that way though.

It's always, ALWAYS been lightest ship fires at any target, just for the record. If the lightest ship dies the next in line is up.

MOAR DELTA-V!!!

Hehehe

It's always, ALWAYS been lightest ship fires at any target, just for the record. If the lightest ship dies the next in line is up.

Well, at least I got the "lightest ship fires first" bit right. No rules broken yet, just bad turn management.
